page.title: 18Language,Welsh,Dialect
page.content: Cil-y-cwm was until recently one of the strongholds of welsh language. During last 10 years however, there has been a rapid decline in number of Welsh speaking inhabitants as large numbers of non welsh speaking people have moved into the area. most are from England, but other nationalities, including Dutch,German, and Swedish. In past young people tended to marry Welsh speakers from within area but this is no longer the case. Although there are no monoglot Welsh (i.e. people who speak only Welsh)some of the older people find it easier to converse in Welsh than in English. There is no local dialect. One encouraging factor is that at least 9 newcomers are making an attempt to learn the Welsh language.
